text: A Somalian man hunches over a body wrapped in a sheet and covers the dead man's face.
The images of a lonely truck driving through ravaged countryside, bodies everywhere.

We now see that the truck is from the Red Cross as _it mo through the ruins of a bombed and burned village. Past bo some dead, some alive. No sound but the wind. Nothing els moves across scorched earth. SUPER: 300,000 CIVILIANS DIE OF STARVATION.
A body wrapped in a sheet is carried away.

head_text.subj: MARINES, FOOD IS DELIVERED AND ORDER IS RESTORED.

text: A U.N. Peacekeeper helps a wearied man drink.

head_text.subj: DECLARES WAR ON THE U.N. PEACEKEEPERS.

text: The Peacekeeper walks past the bodies of dead children.

head_text.subj: IN JUNE, AIDID'S MILITIA AMBUSH AND SLAUGHTER 24 PAKISTAN
SOLDIERS, AND BEGIN TARGETING AMERICAN PERSONNEL.

text: Lifeless refugees are drawn to the aid station.

head_text.subj: DELTA FORCE AND ARMY RANGERS, ARE SENT TO MOGADISHU TO RE

text: (CONTINUED)
Looking out at the smoldering, wind-whipped village from inside a bomb-ravaged house.
The first rays of sunshine hit us -- and a BLACK HAWK HELICOPTER thunders over the arid Somali landscape.
A handsome Ranger, SERGEANT MATT EVERSMANN, surveys the village below.
A make-shift camp surrounding a bombed-out building on a hilltop bustles with energy.

Several "Technicals", old Toyota trucks with heavy machin gun bolted in back, ROAR through the village. Starving residents swarm a five-ton Red Cross transport t loaded with food as the Black Hawk floats slowly past. The scene turns chaotic: villagers shake the truck; Somal soldiers beat them back with sticks; ten-pound sacks of w spill onto the ground; hordes of stick-thin villagers str to grab the sacks. A Somali GUNMAN OPENS FIRE on the mob. Blood splatters as few get hit. Screams. Panic. People scatter.

location: DURANT'S SUPER SIX FOUR BLACK HAWK

text: MATT EVERSMANN jolts from the sight of the bloodbath. Whi inside to the other RANGERS in the Black Hawk's belly.
Oh shit, did you see that? (into headset) Chief, we got unarmed civilians getting shot down here at nine o'clock! (CONTINUED)
Durant surveys the scene below, then calmly speaks into h headset.
I got it Matt, I don't think we can touch this. Heavily armed Militiamen train weapons on the populace. O shouts into a megaphone:
(in Somali, subtitled) This food is the roperty of Mohammed Farrah Aidid! Go back to your homes! Durant's Black Hawk circles the village.
Command, Super Six Four we got militia shooting unarmed civilians down at the food distribution center. Request permission to engage.
Super Six Four, are you taking fire, over? Somali Militia men flee into the crowd as Delta sniper SG DAN BUSCH trains his AR-15 rifle on the gunmen below.
Negative, Command.
U.N.'sS jurisdiction, Six Four. We can't intervene. Return to base. Over.

(frustrated) Roger. Six Four returning. Durant continues the chopper away from the village. ON _EVERSMANN - staring down at the carnage-strewn street below. He can't believe it. BELOW - The militia man aims his megaphone at the Black H as though he's firing a gun at it.
The market bustles with activity. Militia men stroll the streets, automatic rifles strapped across their backs. HOOT slinks through the crowd, following a Somali DRIVER.
OSMAN ATTO, a wealthy Somali businessman, reads a USA Tod as he eats. The driver approaches.
(subtitled) Ready, Mr. Atto.
The driver leads Atto to the waiting car. Hoot watches, s into a microphone in his collar.
Leaving. Atto gets in his car and leaves.
Atto's caravan speeds through the dusty streets.
Several Black Hawk Helicopters track the caravan out of t
Atto smokes a cigar in the back seat, talks on his cell p A Black Hawk Helicopter appears out the truck's window, f beside them.
(subtitled) Sir! Atto looks out the window at the Black Hawk.
(subtitled) Keep driving. (CONTINUED)

A Ranger fires at_the hood of Atto's car, spraying oil al over the windshield. An MH-6 Little Bird, a transport chopper with two outside benches, lands in front of the caravan, forcing them to s Rangers surround Atto's vehicle and tap on the glass.
(calmly into phone, subtitled) I'm going to be late. Call you back.

Silence. The room is dark, except for the dusty yellow st cast from the window. Atto sits at a.table as GENERAL GARRISON enters and sets cup opposite him. Garrison wears khaki shorts and_T-shirt and dons sunglasses in the poorly lit room. He's laconic. eady. Atto offers Garrison a cigar.
No, no thanks. I've got one.
These are Cuban. Bolivar. Bellicoso. Garrison holds up his own cigar.
(unimpressed, simply) So's this.
(laughs) Miami, my friend, is not Cuba... Garrison simply stares out the window. Atto lights his ci regards it for a moment.
I see not catching Aidid is becoming a routine.
We weren't trying to catch Aidid, we were trying to catch you.
Me? (laughs) But am I that important? I hardly think so. (CONTINUED)
You're just a business man.
Trying to make a living. Garrison finally takes a seat opposite Atto.
Selling guns to Aidid's militia.
(a beat, gravely) You've been here what, six weeks? Six weeks you are trying to catch the General. You put up your wanted posters. $25,000... what is this, gunfight at the K.O. corral?
(laughs) It's ah, it's the 0.K. Corral.
Do you think bringing me in will make him suddenly come to you? Make him more agreeable? Hmm?
(simply) You know where he sleeps. You pay for his beds, much less his militia. (the bottom line) We're not leaving Somalia until we find him. And we will find him.

(immediately) Don't make the mistake of thinking because I grew up without running water I'm simple, General. I do know something about history. See all this? It's simply shaping tomorrow -- a tomorrow without a lot of Arkansas white-boy's ideas in it.
Well, I wouldn't know about that, I'm from Texas. (CONTINUED)
Mr. Garrison, I think you shouldn't have come here. This is civil war. This is our war, not yours.
(finally rips off his sunglasses) 300,000 dead and counting; That's_ not a war, Mr. Atto, that's genocide. Now you enjoy that tea, you hear? Garrison exits swiftly past two U.S. Marine guards.
Garrison strides through the hangar, past helicopters.
How'd he strike you? JOE CRIBBS, a tall, lean man a few years younger than Garrison, falls into step beside the General.
Urbane, sophisticated. Cruel.
Yeah, he's a good catch. (they stop) It'll take some time, but Aidid'1l feel the loss.
I'm not sure time is something we've got in great supply.
This isn't Iraq, you know. It's more complicated than that. Garrison starts away. Cribbs trails him.
Boss, most of Washington might disagree. I'm just saying, they've been calling for these dang situation reports every morning this week.
(slips the sunglasses back on) Well, tell 'em the situation is ah, fragile. (CONTINUED)
And with that Garrison exits a door into BLINDING SUNLIGH
Black Hawk pilot CLIFF "ELVIS" WOLCOTT addresses his Rang passengers as he prepares for take-off.

Well ladies and gentlemen, my name is Cliff "Elvis" Wolcott. I'll be your pilot this afternoon. Federal regulations has designated this is a non-smoking Black Hawk helicopter. For those of you enrolled in our Mogadishu frequent flyer program, you'll be earning a hundred free credits this afternoon, and as always, the air sickness bags are located in the seat back in front of you.
Number one indications are good, Cliff.
You got it.
Clear on two.
And you're still clear at one. The Black Hawk takes off into the blaring sun.

head_text.subj: BETWEEN BLACK HAWK SUPER SIX ONE AND DURANT'S BL

text: HAWK as they skirt the coastline.
Six One, this is Six Four. Go to UHF secure. I've got some bad news.
Limo's a word Durant, I don't want to hear about it.
It is not a word, it's an abbreviation of a word. (CONTINUED)
Limo is a word in common usage. That is the key phrase in Scrabble, my good friend. Common usage.
No! If it is not in the dictionary, it doesn't count.
It doesn't have to be in the dictionary!
It does have to be in the dictionary!
They don't say limousine, they say limo!
Listen, when we get back to the base, it's coming off the board. Durant and Elvis rubber-neck as they pass each other, fly opposite directions.
You touch my limo and I'1l spank you, night stalker, you hear me?
Yeah, promises.
That's a nice beach down there. How's the water?
Yeah, it's nice and warm. It's loaded with sharks.
The clean slap of computer keys. A cigarette smolders. Ra clerk SGT. JOHN GRIMES types data into a computer. Standi opposite his desk is PFC TODD BLACKBURN.
Name?
Todd. (CONTINUED)
Last name?
Blackburn.
(Grimes enters the info) First name Todd.
So what's it like?
(without looking up) What's what like?
Mogadishu. The fighting.
Serial number?
(enters the info, then) irstly, it's "The MOG, or simply: "Mog." flo one calls it’ Mogadishu here, Secondly, I wouldn't know about the fighting, so don't ask.
Why not?

Didn't I just say "don't ask"? (takes a drag off cigarette) Look kid, you look like you're about twelve, so let me explain something to you. I have a rare and mysterious skill that precludes me from going on missions.
Typing?
(pauses typing) Can you type?
No. (CONTINUED)
(immediately resumes typing) Date of birth?
Like chiseling into a headstone, Grimes types into the "a field - 18. Hands young Blackburn his I.D.
(affirmatively) Well I'm here to kick some ass.

Hoot smokes a cigar on top of a sand dune as a Black Hawk passes over him. We see that he is holding his mountain b Wolcott lands the Black Hawk Super Six One on the beach, kicks up a storm of sand. Hoot shoulders his bike, hustle into the chopper.
(over the ROAR of the chopper blades) Nice man, very smooth!
(impressed with himself) Single shot through the engine block!
Shit, that's a shame man. That's a nice jeep. The Black Hawk lifts off and kicks up a cloud of sand as flies away.
A line of Rangers fire M-16s at targets. A military "Hummer" drives up to the range. Behind the firing line, Eversmann blows a WHISTLE. (CONTINUED)
Cease fire, cease fire! (the shooting stops) Check your weapons. Grimes and Blackburn approach from the Hummer.
Sergeant Eversmann! (as Eversmann turns) Sarge.
Private First Class Blackburn.
(blankly) Yeah?
Reporting for duty.
Not to me you're not. You're reporting to Lieutenant Beales. He should be around here somewhere.
Can I leave him with you? Grimes just wants to leave. He's got things to do. Eversm smirks -- go head, go.
Yeah, go ahead. (to Blackburn) You brought your weapon?
Sergeant. Want me to shoot? I'm rested.
When'd you get in?
Just now, Sergeant. Blackburn looks so young and eager, and already sunburned down one side of his face from the chopper ride.
A herd of wild boars flees from the chopper.  13.
Upon sight of the boars Hoot cocks his rifle.
Hey, who's hungry? The other Rangers smirk.
Hoot stands before a wild boar on a rotating BBQ spit. Me move along the chow line. CAPTAIN STEELE, Ranger ground commander, steps up behind Delta Sergeant SANDERSON in line.
What is this, Sanderson? Another taxpayer funded Delta safari?
Not if General Garrison's asking.
No, I'm asking.
Have a nice meal, Captain. IN THE LINE -- Hoot cuts in front of Blackburn, grabs foo
Hey man, there's a line.
I know.
Well, this isn't the back of it.
Man, I know.
Sergeant, Sergeant? Hoot turns to see Steel staring at him.
What's going on here? Sanderson watches them from down the chow line. (CONTINUED)
Oh, just some aerial target practice sir, didn't want to leave it behind.
I'm talking about your weapon. Delta or no Delta, that's a hot weapon. You know better than that. You're patety should be on at all times on ase.
(shows Steele his finger) Well this is my safety, sir. Hoot walks off with his plate of food. Sanderson stops St from going after Hoot.
Let it go sir, the guy hasn't eaten in a couple of days.

You Dboys are a bunch of undisciplined cowboys. Let me tell you something, soldier. When we get on the five yard line you re onna need my Rangers. Ya'll better Learn to be team players. It's rough out ere. Sanderson walks away as LT. COLONEL MCKNIGHT watches from his table.

The barracks is divided by the arrangement of the cots. Rangers here, Delta there, relaxing over Risk, Stratego, cribbage, cards, Gameboys. Ping-pong games in the corner. Pilots Durant and Wolcott are continuing their Scrabble g PILLA stands before a group of young men as though he's o stage. He imitates Captain Steele, much to the amusement the men. Pilla tries to hide his thick "Joyzee" accent:

Speak up! (touches his forehead) You say this is your safety? Well this is my boot Son, and it will fit up your ass with the proper amount of force. Off to the side Eversmann writes a letter. (CONTINUED)
Is that a Jersey accent?
It's Georgia.

(to another Ranger) You'se guys, I'm trying to do this. Give me a break. (back in character) Take those sunglasses off, Soldier. Delta wants to wear Oakleys, that's their business, I don't want to see them on you again, hooah? Other Rangers laughingly mock his "hooah."
Hey, is that a hot weapon? DELTA SECTION - Gordon plops in a seat opposite Shughart Shughart studies a critical move, finger on his bishop.
Is that your move?
My hand on the piece?
I mate you in three whatever you do.
I'd keep my eye on that queen before counseling with others.

Well she's just lying in wait. NEARBY - WEX, the oldest Delta at 42, sketches on a pad. Busch leans over to see: a medieval knight dragging an enormous sword through a dense forest. Beautiful and scar
Wex. It's good. You're improving.
(Wex shrugs, it's okay) Ah.
If I may make a suggestion, observation? (CONTINUED)
Mmm hmm?
It's a children's book, right?
Right.
They are not supposed to scare the living shit out of children.
This is the part of the story where our knight, our warrior is about to slay the one-eyed dragon and that's scary. Besides, my daughter loves this stuff.
I thought you finished that last week. Hmm?
You done? I had to get a visual. Across the hangar, Pilla is still doing his impression of Steele for the group.

Hey, we are at the ten yard line here men, you understand? Can you count? One, two, ten. Okay? Where are my running backs? Where are my running backs? The Rangers laugh and respond with emphatic "hooahs". Pil doesn't notice as Steele enters.

Hey, I didn't see you in church on Sunday soldier. Had something more important to do? Not on Sunday you don't. Not anymore. I will make you believe. You understand? Pilla turns and finds himself face-to-face with Steele himself. Goes ashen. Other Rangers watch to see what happ next. Steele, surprisingly, smiles good-naturedly.
That's pretty funny, hooah? (CONTINUED)
The Rangers respond with a slight "hooah".
See, it's a good impression. I recognize myself. All right, carry on. Even though Steele seems to be taking it well, Pilla isn' able to relax.
A quick word, specials. Pilla turns around and Steele grabs him in a headlock. Th Rangers laugh. Pilla flips the Rangers off behind his bac
Yes, Sir?
If I_ever see you undermine me again, you'll be cleaning latrines with your tongue until you can't taste he difference between shit and french fries. Is that clear?
Hooah, sir.

All right. The Rangers applaud Pilla as he returns and plops on a co between two guys. ANOTHER CORNER - KURTH, WADDELL, NELSON, and GOODALE talk around Eversmann, who busies himself with his letter. LT. BEALES is reading a book on Somalia.
Listen to this, if one skinny kills another skinny, his clan owes the dead guy's clan a hundred camels. A hundred camels. Waddell looks up from his book.
Camels. I wouldn't pay one camel.
Must be a lot of fucking camel debt. (carves on a piece of wood) Is that really true lieutenant? (CONTINUED)
Eversmann 18.
Ask Sergeant Eversmann. He likes the skinnies. finally looks up.
Eversmann, you really like the skinnies?
It's not that I like them or I don't like them. I respect them. Kurth leans back in his chair and deals the cards. They wait interest. Kurth star
cover int
See, what you guys fail to realize is, Sergeant here is a bit of an idealist. Believes in this mission down to his very bones. Don't you, Sergeant?

Look these people, they have no jobs, no food, no education, no future. I just figure that, you know, I mean, we either, we have two things we can do, we can either help, or we can sit back and watch the country destroy itself on CNN. Right?
I don't know about you guys, but I was trained to fight. Were you trained to fight, Sergeant? for an answer. Lt. Beales watches him with bemused Eversmann chooses his words carefully.
Well, I think I was trained to make a difference, Kurth. ts laughing.
Like the man said, he's an idealist. (he looks at the TV) Oh wait, this is my favorite part. - A sniper fires at Steve Martin, who ducks for he gas station. (CONTINUED)

Everyone cracks up, but no one as_hard as Beales. Beales literally falling off his chair. It takes a moment for th others to realize he isn't laughing; he's choking on his tongue, having a seizure. A Ranger hurries to his side, waves the others back.
No-no-no! Stay back, stay back! Eversmann stands, moves closer for a better look. The Ran cradles Beales.
John, John, it's okay. John, John, John, it's okay.
A speaker high atop a mosque calls out a morning prayer.
A young Somali wearing a baseball cap backwards is on his knees, praying on the deserted beach in front of the old city. Then shoulders his rifle and gathers his things to
Eversmann waits outside the tent as Steele approaches.

Well, he'll be fine, but not in this army He's out of the game. He's epileptic, going home. (walks past Eversmann, turns back) I'm putting you in charge of his chalk. (off Eversmann's reaction) You got a problem with that?
No, sir.
Now it's a big responsibility. Your men are going to look to you to make the right decisions. Their lives depend on it. (CONTINUED)
That's great. That makes Eversmann feel more anxious abou it.
All right.
Rangers are the way, Sir.
All the way. Good luck, son. Steele walks away. Eversmann turns back to the Infirmary tent, enters and waves to Beales, considering the enormit of the duty he's just been given.

Cacophony of noise and voices. The crowded outdoor Bakara Market is in the center of the city. The young baseball cap wearing Somali (TYE-DIE) we saw pr on the beach now stands before a merchant who wants to se him a machine gun, demonstrating by firing into the air. one even looks over. "Tie-Dye" appears to be more interested in a group of militiamen talking above the stall's belts of ammunition, on the balcony. A door opens behind them and two of Aidid's Lieutenants emerge. The armed militiamen get up and escort the pair p Tie-Dye without a look or word of acknowledgement except last of them, who gives the subtlest of gestures - an alm imperceptible nod.
A long-anticipated meeting of Aidid's senior cabinet may take place today at fifteen hundred hours.
Garrison briefs Delta, Black Hawk pilots, and four Ranger chalk leaders, including Eversmann. McKnight, Steele, Cri Matthews and Harrell are in front, the rest behind. (CONTINUED)

And I say may, because we all know by now, with the intel we get on the street, nothing is certain. This is actual intel, confirmed by three sources. Two tier one personalities may be present. (points to two enlarged photos) Omar Salad, Aidid's top political advisor; and Abdi Hassan Awale interior minister. These are the guys we're after. Delta let the photos burn into their retinas. Garrison lo at Captain Steele.

Today we go. Same mission template as before. Garrison's hand moves past an overhead map of Mogadishu, points to another map: the outline of a general "target uilding." Two building entrances are marked "D" for Delta The men take notes as they listen.

15:45, Assault Force Delta will infiltrate the target building and seize all suspects within. Security Force: Rangers. Four Ranger chalks under the command of Captain Steele will rope in at 15:46... (points to four corners on map) ...and hold a four-corner perimeter around the target building. No one gets in or out. (as McKnight looks on) Extraction Force: Lt. Colonel McKnight's Humvee column will drive into the city at 15:47 On Halwadig Road and hold just short of the Olympic Hotel, here -- (points to the map) Wait for the green light. Now once Delta gives the word, McKnight's column will move to the target building and load the prisoners on flatbed trucks. Immediately after the prisoners are loaded, the four Ranger Chalks will collapse back to the target building, load up on Humvees, and the entire ground force will exfil the three miles back to base. Mission time from incursion to extraction: no longer than 30 minutes. (CONTINUED)
Garrison, still standing before them, lets this sink in.

Now, I had requested light armor and AC-130 Spectre Gunships, but Washington, in all it's wisdom, decide against this. Too high- profile. Black Hawks and Little Birds will provide the air cover with miniguns and 275 rockets. Colonel Harrell? Garrison sits as he glances over at COLONEL HARRELL.
In_the C 2 Bird: Colonel Matthews will coordinate the air mission, and I will coordinate ground forces. Colonel Matthews? COLONEL MATTHEWS, early forties, speaks up.
Mission launch codeword is Irene. Questions?
Which building is it, sir?
Exactly which building we're confirming right now. Somewhere around the Bakara Market. Garrison regards Hoot's reaction, then the others.
(primarily to Hoot) I don't choose the time or place of their meetings.
I didn't say a word, Sir. There is an unspoken unease in the room.

We're going into the hornet's nest today. You give them time to react and they'll swarm. Make no mistake. Once you're in the Bakara Market, you're in an entirely hostile district. Don't underestimate their capabilities. (CONTINUED)
Eversmann swallows, checks the others' reactions.

Now we'll be going through friendly neighborhoods before we hit the market. So remember the "Rules of Engagement": no one fires unless fired upon. So let's go get this thing done. Good luck, gentlemen.

The group files out. McKnight, the most obviously concern of them, lights a cigarette and slaps closed his Zippo lighter. Eversmann watches from inside the tent as Colone Matthews and Harrell walk up to McKnight.
What's the matter, Danny, something you don't like?

(as if it's nothing) No Spectre gunships, daylight instead of night, late afternoon when they're all fucked up on khat, only part of the city Aidid can mount a serious counter-attack on short notice, what's not to like?
Life's imperfect.
Yeah, for you two, circling above it at 500 feet, it's imperfect. Down in the street, it's unforgiving. Eversmann continues to watch from inside the tent. He hea it all.
An alley. Tie-Dye rips lengths of black duct tape and pre them to the roof of his battered car in the shape of an X
Smith plays basketball as Eversmann works at a desk.
What the fuck, Smith? (CONTINUED)
Well?
Well, what?
We going?
Why should I tell you that?
Because I'm me.
Three o'clock. Downtown. Bakara market.
Alright.
Listen, Smith. I need you to back me up out there today, all right? Keep sharp.
Yes sir, Sergeant Eversmann.
All right.
Ev? (hot-Dogs with the basketball) It's gonna be nothing man. Nothing. Smith runs off in to the hangar bouncing the basketball.
At a filing cabinet, Grimes carefully pushes the plunger down on the coffee grounds in the coffee pot. He speaks o his shoulder to the only other person in the cluttered of Sizemore.
It's all in the grind, Sizemore. Can't be too fine, can't be too coarse. This my friend is a science. Turns, holding the coffee pot. (CONTINUED)

I mean - you're looking at the guy that believed the commercials, you know? About be all you can be. I made coffee through Desert Storm. I made coffee through Panama, while everyone else got to fight, got to be a Ranger. As Grimes blathers, Sizemore reaches for a letter opener, shoves it down his still-drying cast and scratches away.

Now it's Grimesy, black, one sugar. Or Grimesy, got a powdered anywhere? Adds just the right amount of sugars. Grimes finally turn and approaches Sizemore, sitting at a desk, trying to itc under the still-wet cast. Hands Sizemore the mug.
What happened to you?
Ping-pong accident.
What?
So guess what? Your wish has been granted. You're going out today.
You're fuckin' me.
You're taking my place assisting the sixty gunner. Sergeant Eversmann said to get your stuff and get ready. Now Grimes is speechless. Sizemore relishes the moment.
It's what you wanted, isn't it?

(gripping his coffee) Oh yeah. Hell, yeah. Grimes is apoplectic. His eyes glaze over with a thousand yard stare. It's exactly what he wanted, but now that it' come to him, he's not at all sure it's what he really wan  34 26.
Delta and Rangers, in their respective areas, prepare in their own ways, gathering equipment they think they'll ne leaving behind what they don't. Eversmann calls out to Grimes.
Grimsey! I want you to stick with Waddell and give him ammo when he needs it. Hooah?
(softly) Hooah.
I wouldn't worry 'bout that. Generally speaking, Somalis can't shoot for snit.
Don't worry about it. Just watch out for the Sammies throwing the fucking rocks and you'll be fine. Might even e fun. The other guys snicker at this.
You boys do their thing now. What we gotta do is cover them, choppers gonna cover us. And we'll be all right.

Look you guys, I know this is my first time as ah, Chalk leader... But ah, this is serious. We're Rangers, not some sorry_ass J.R.0O.T.C. We're elite. Let's act like it out there. Hooah? The guys all "hooah".

Any questions? We're gonna be okay. All right, grab your gear. Let's move out. A few guys "hooah" again, disperse. Eversmann exhales hea INTERCUT, Delta, methodical and precise, no talk: Hoot ta the pins of grenades. Grimes starts to fill a canteen. (CONTINUED)
You're not going to need that, dude, we're not out there long enough. Grimes sets it back. Sees YUREK reach for a NOD - Night Observation Device - and reaches for one himself.
Hey you're not going to need that ei her, we're back before dark. You might as well take dope and beer instead. Grimes just stares. Twombly, of course, is kidding.
What?
Ammo, dude. Take ammo. Yurek puts the NODs back. Grimes sees Joyce removing the rear panel of his Kevlar vest. Joyce notices Grimes watch
Let me tell you something Grimes. You've got about fifty pounds of gear as it is, you don't need another twelve. I_don't know about you but, I'm not planning on getting shot in the back running away.
Well I better keep mine in.

Hey, Grimes? The most impor tant thing? Just remember when everybody else is shooting, shoot in the same direction. All right. INTERCUT: Eversmann considers Blackburn, who appears more fidgety than before. As Joyce's putting on his armor, he watches Wex across th hangar tearing off pieces of masking tape and writing something on them with a Sharpie. Sticks them to his boot
Look at this guy, Lo. Taping his blood type to his boots. It's bad uck.
No it's smart. (CONTINUED)
SGT. LORENZO RUIZ pulls out an already addressed and seal envelope, regards it.
All Delta do that.
(re: the letter) That's bad luck too, man. Come on, let's go. Ruiz holds the letter. Joyce gets up and walks past him. Ruiz turns to a glum Sizemore.
It's a good thing you're right handed, Adonis. (mimes like he's jacking off) If not, I don't know what you'd do.
You're a funny guy, man. Ruiz profers the letter to Sizemore.
I'm not taking no death letter.
(shoves it in his hand) We have a deal.
I'll give it back to you in an hour.
You okay?
Excited. In a good way. I've been training my whole life for this.
You ever shot at anybody before?
No, Sargent. (CONTINUED)
Me neither. Eversmann pats Blackburn on the shoulder.
2:29 PM A Black Hawk hovers over Tie- Dye's battered car.
Tie-Dye drives along the streets, deeper into the city th the U.N. ever goes.
A Black Hawk hovers high above the car, following.
Garrison and Cribbs watch the image from the C2 chopper, HEAR the annoying music over the command net.
Think he's reliable?
Well, we'll see. It's his first time out.
Local pop music jangles on the radio as Tie-Dye drives. H drips with sweat.
Tell him to turn his damn radio off.
Yes, sir. Tell him to turn his radio off.
Abdu, you need to turn your radio off.  43 44 45 46 47 30.
Tie-Dye follows the order, switches the radio off.
The machine sitting on a counter next to a refrigerator covered with snapshots and reminder notes. A dog listens the outgoing message:
Hi, mommy and daddy aren't home. Leave me a message.
Hey baby, it's me, you there? Pick up if you're there.
Shughart is on a satellite phone, huddled against a wall.

I'm just calling to check up on you and make sure everything's all right. I'll call in a couple of hours. You better not be sleeping. Gordon moves a chess piece, then passes Shughart still on the phone.
You're move, Randy.
I'm missing you. I love you, baby. The call disconnects.
Hello, hello?
Eversmann leans against a wall next to Hoot. Silence betw them, Eversmann looks off.
You know, it's kinda funny. Beautiful beach, beautiful sun... it'd almost be a good place to visit. (CONTINUED)
Eversmann 31. 47
Almost.
(off Hoot's tone) You don't think we should be here.
Know what I think? Don't really matter what I think. Once that first bullet goes past your head -- politics, and all that shit -- just goes right out the window.
I just wanna do it right today.
Just watch your corner...get all your men back here alive. turns to Hoot, grave.
Tie-Dye's
car moves deeper into the city.
An overhead image of Tie-Dye's car and surrounding street
Is this supposed to be the place or did his car just take a dump?
Avi come in.
Avi, can you hear me? Is this the place?
Tie-Dye sits and stares at the people in the street.
Avi, come in? Avi, can you hear me, is this the place?
To my right hand side, above the cafe.  52 53 54 55 56 57 32.
Sir, he says this is the building.
He's certain? Garrison looks at the overhead images.
Avi, you need to be sure. Are you sure?
Well, it's down the road two blocks around my left.
Now he's saying the building's actually a couple blocks down, but if he's’ seen outside it he'll be shot.
I'll fuckin' shoot him myself a couple of blocks down. Tell him I want his skinny ass parked in front of the damn building. He's not getting paid until he does exactly that.
McKnight addresses his men.
It's three miles to the target area. We're never off the main roads. In the background, soldiers move and prepare MH-6 Little Birds.
At the K-4 traffic circle we turn north, then east on National. We wait 'til Delta's finished, here. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)
Then we roll up in force on Halwadig. We load the prisoners and then the assault and blocking forces, and bring 'em back. Home in an hour. Okay? McKnight looks at Pilla, Othic, other gunners.

Now there will be some. shooting. Bakara Market is the Wild West. But be careful_what you shoot at because people do live there. Hooah. Several "hooah" in response as McKnight and the rest up a leave.
Tie-Dye's
car moves through the streets.
The overhead image of Tie-Dye's car on a screen.
The last one of these guys shot | himself in the head playing Russian Roulette in a bar.
Tie-Dye's
car rattles up to a three-story building. Stops.
The overhead image on a screen.
Sir, the vehicle stopped.
So this is the real deal now? He's sure this time?
He sounds scared shitless.
Good. That's always a good sign.
Tie-Dye exits the car, opens the hood. Fans the steaming radiator fumes.  63 64 65 66 34.
The overhead image on a screen.
(turning to leave) Alright, all QRF out of the airspace.
All QRF out of the airspace.
Colonel Matthews speaks into his headset:
All units, Irene. I say again, Irene. INT. WOLCOTT'S BLACK HAWK - CONT. Wolcott and his copilot make sure things are in order.
(into his headset) Irene!
Durant smiles, speaks into his headset.
Fuckin' Irene!
Rangers deploy across the tarmac to their respective chop Garrison has come out to wish the men well, moving past t open doors of Eversmann's Black Hawk, shouting over the n
Good luck boys... be careful... no one gets left behind. He gives the thumbs up and leaves. Blackburn and Grimes n Eversmann still looking after the general with some conce
(almost together) What's wrong? (CONTINUED)
Nothing. He's just never done that before.
Ah, fuck!

Let's go! McKnight's Humvee column rumbles away from the tarmac. IN SUPER SIX ONE - Elvis Wolcott flashes a satisfied grin the sound of the code word. He lifts tip on the controls THE ARMADA ascends, deafening. Little Birds whirl skyward Delta carried aloft outside the choppers, the ultimate th ride. Black Hawks rise from the earth in tight formation.
The dark, barely-furnished room from before. Alone in it, Atto watches a glass rattle across the table from the thu of the helicopters taking off outside.

Just outside the base, against barren terrain near the co a kid wearing a BeeGees t-shirt and flip-flops tends a sm fire. As the helicopters continue to rise, the boy finds a cell phone in his pants pocket and makes a call.
Another kid with a cell phone hurries across a rooftop. H shouts down --
Mo'Alim! The kid drops the phone. It falls into a waiting pair of hands of an Aidid militia man. He carries the phone in to MO'ALIM, an Aidid lieutenant, sprawled out asleep on a be
Mo'Alim! The Militia Man wakes Mo'Alim up with the phone. Mo'Alim puts the phone to his ear and hears a Doppler-thunder of helicopters --  70 71 72 73 36.
The first boy is holding the phone up like a badge as the helicopters thunder over him.
Mo'Alim and his militia arm themselves. Men shout and pas off guns to more men.
Black Hawks move low and fast, following the Humvee carav along a road. Then parallel to the shore over the running breakers. INT. WOLCOTT'S BLACK HAWK - CONT.
Grimsey! Eversmann taps his helmet and throws a pen to Grimes. Gri writes his name on his helmet.
Two minutes! Eversmann holds up two fingers.
Two minutes.

Tie-Dye stands waiting outside his car. The militia barricade the streets and start burning tires Mo'Alim rides forward on a convoy. INT. WOLCOTT'S BLACK HAWK - CONT. BELOW - black smoke from piles of burning tires rises int the sky as--
(shouts in Nelson's ear) Why are they burning tires?
Signals, to the militia! (CONTINUED)
Garrison watches the overhead image.
Briley holds up one finger and mouths one minute.
One minute.
One minute! Waddell dog-ears a page of his book. Eversmann's chalk prepares to go in. Blackburn sees Nelson putting in a football mouth guard.
What's that for?
Last rope, I almost bit my tongue off! Nelson smiles back at him, black plastic over his teeth.
The Humvee convoy rolls in as people run through the stre
Tie-Dye sits in his car and waits for the Black Hawks to land. Militia run through the streets, firing sporadicall

Little Birds land in the street. One of the Little Birds streaks in and lands on the roof of the building. Hoot's the other two descend lower, onto the street, the rotors just missing the walls of the building. A dust cloud enve them all. Rangers deploy on the street and the Little Bir swiftly take off. Rangers move low and fast, storm into buildings in tactic formations. Fire and kill militiamen. Tie-Dye pulls away as a Black Hawk approaches the buildin through the smoke. Ropes drop from some helicopters.  77 78 79 80 81 38.
Through the cockpit, Eversmann sees nothing below but a massive swirling cloud of dust. Speaks into his headset m
Ropes! FAST ROPES are kicked out the chopper door, snaking down into the dust cloud as Eversmann's men prepare to go in.
Kurth, Goodale, Doc Schmid all start roping down. Bullets are already PINGING off the belly of the Black Hawk.
Garrison watches the overhead image.

Delta come through the dust and smoke of flashbangs like apparitions. Hoot, Wex and other Delta burst into a room, see ten Somalia trying to find another escape route. Bett dressed than most Somalis, this group carries file folder maps, charts, scattered on a table, and AK-47s. Bingo.
Down, get down! DOWN! DOWN! DO IT
Somalis hit the deck, foot in the back for their troubles they don't do it fast enough. Surrendered weapons clatter the floor.
McKnight, now out of his Humvee, peeks calmly around the corner of a building.
Let's go, let's go! The remaining men start roping down. Grimes swallows hard He's next. Crew Chief DOWDY shouts to him: (CONTINUED)
No fear!
Oh yeah, right. With that, Grimes disappears; down the rope sliding into dust and into the gunfire.
McKnight's convoy reaches its waiting position just off Halwadig. Pilla, in his turret, hears shots, sees bullets spark off the side of the Humvee.
Colonel, they're shooting at us! Colonel, they're shooting at us!
Well shoot back! A hail of gunfire erupts and Pilla swings the fifty turre Sights a technical racing toward him. He FIRES on it.
Super Six Five leaving, going in to holding pattern.
Super Six Two, come in. Take up perimeter pattern
Roger that. IN THE CHOPPER - still in silence, Blackburn remains.
Go Blackburn, go! Go Blackburn! Just as he says this, Eversmann sees an RPG streaking up them.
(to Pilot)
(to Blackburn) Hold on! The Black Hawk ROCKS to avoid the rocket. (CONTINUED)

--BLACKBURN reaches for the rope, sees it swing away and of the grasp of his gloved hands, EVERSMANN stares as the kid FREE FALLS, disappearing into the swirling dust cloud Horrified, Eversmann dives out after him, grabbing onto t rope.
No!
Eversmann fast-ropes through the cloud for what seems to forever. Finally, his feet touch down. He scrambles to Blackburn -- having fallen 40 feet to the dirt street.
D-2, we got a man fallen.
Six Four, you're a sitting duck there. Get out and take cover pattern.
Roger that. Six one leaving. The Black Hawk starts away.
Eversmann checks Blackburn who lies still. He and Blackbu are alone in the middle of the street. Over the sharp cra of gunfire --
Doc! Doc Schmid! Schmid, the medic who benched Sizemore, suddenly appears with his kit from behind Eversmann, startling him.
Where's he hit?
He's not. He fell.
What?
He fell!  85 86 41.
Grimes dives on his belly, bullets hissing through the ai around him. Waddell is sighting with the SAW, but not fir at a group of fleeting figures down the block.
Why aren't you shooting?
We're not being shot at yet.
How can you tell?
A hiss means it's close. A snap...

Now they're shooting at us! Waddell levels withering fire down the street. The fleeti figures scatter. Grimes sees figures with weapons firing at him a block aw He levels his gun and SHOOTS! He's shooting at the enemy!
Eversmann, in the middle of it with Blackburn, yells acro to his radio man, Galentine. Waves him over.
Galentine! Get me Captain Steele! Get me Captain Steele!
Uniform Six Four, this is Uniform Two Five, come in, over. Uniform Six Five, this is Uniform Two Five Two. Schmid moves Blackburn's head -- blood seeping from his n and ears.

I can't get him! Galentine doesn't know why. Something wrong with the radi maybe. Eversmann unholsters his walkie-talkie, and as he shouts into it, he can SEE Delta spilling from the first building out into the street. (CONTINUED)

Juliet Six Four, this is Chalk Four. We got a man down! We gotta get him out of here. Over! EXT. INTERCUT - STEELE'S CHALK ONE - CONT. Steele's men are fanned cut, taking random gunfire. Steel sees the Delta, running down the block toward him and int different building. Eversmann's voice squawks on the walk
Six four, say again, two five, over!
He's hurt. He fell. Over.
Take a breath Two Five and calm down! Over!
Man down!
Missed your last response, again?
Garrison sits down and watches the overhead image. He rub his temples.
Schmid shouts out to anyone.
Get me a stretcher! Two men unfold a collapsible litter from a medic pack. Th gingerly place Blackburn on it.
Go!
Okay, go! They run through a hail of gun fire.  89 90 91 92 93 43.
Delta has moved the prisoners out on to the balcony. They kneel facing the wall.
Secure.
Let's move out!
Let's go, let's go!
Schmid and his team carry Blackburn on the stretcher.
Delta has marched the prisoners into an inner courtyard. Everyone waiting. Hoot speaks into a walkie talkie --
K.O. Six Four, green light.
Garrison sits at the panel of screens.
Ready for extraction, over.
That's it. We're done.
Roger that Kilo One One, we'll relay. Uniform Six Four, ready for extraction.
McKnight shouts as he leaps into the Humvee:
Roger that. There's the call! Let's move out! Let's move out!
Hold on! (CONTINUED)

The Humvee squad rumbles around the corner, rolls down th line. McKnight leads them to a Humvee, starts passing Blackburn inside to a waiting Delta medic. EXT. HALWADIG ROAD - CONT. Gunfire from rooftops across the street force Delta to br out prisoners in contained groups of three. Other Delta r fire, driving back snipers. As soon as one disappears, an sniper pops up.
How much time do you need?
Five minutes, Sir!
What?
Five minutes!
You've only got five minutes! McKnight turns around and walks over to Schmid.
What happened to him?
He fell, missed the rope.
How'd he do that? (off Schmid's shrug) Put him in that op! Hoot comes back out of the target courtyard with Sanderso They move the Somali prisoners out.
Let's go, let's go. Come on, let's move! Blackburn is loaded in to a Humvee. GRIMES has been engrossed in watching them load prisoners (CONTINUED)

When he turns around be sees Schmid, Smith and Waddell WA THE HELL up the street, running back toward Chalk 4. He c see them taking fire as they run, moving from cover to co ON GRIMES - oh shit. He starts charging after them. Barel ets three feet when a rocket explodes near him, gausing i o tumble. Turns and charges back to Chalk One and safety.

Schmid, Smith and Waddell come charging up, take cover, o of breath from the long, dangerous run. The rest of the chalk are spread out, returning fire. Eversmann hears an approaching Little Bird and glances up As it thunders over him, hot casings splash down like rai burning him.
Oh, fuck! Eversmann pulls a casing out of his flack jacket.
Hoot marches more prisoners out. Two Somali boys stare at them from the corner like they'r circus attraction.
Let's go, right here! Come on!
(calls out) Struecker! (grabs a radio) Formula C-4, I need to send out a three Humvee with a critical casualty, he looks real bad. I need to evac now!
Roger that, Uniform Six Four. We'll shot a team of gunships to you, over. INT. TARGET BUILDING - CONT.
Roger that. (CONTINUED)
McKnight grabs Sanderson.
I need extra security on these Humvees. Hoot motions for his team. Says to McKnight:
I'll go! I'll take my team, make sure they get back okay.
(nods) Sure.
Struecker, you're lead Humvee! SERGEANT STRUECKER, Iowa farm boy, born-again Christian a model Ranger jumps up.

Hooah! EXT. TARGET BUILDING - CONT. Strueker is behind the wheel of a Humvee, Blackburn in ba Medic tending to him. Hoot and his team jumps in the Humv Hoot riding shotgun next to Struecker. Struecker hits the gas. The three Humvees take off.
Snipers on the rooftops fire. A hail of shots hits the tr like a cadence of drums. From the Humvees the turret men return fire. Pilla blasts away with his. 50, covering their asses.
How're things going? Are things okay there, Struecker?
I don't want to talk about it now, Colonel.
Anyone hit? (CONTINUED)

Struecker and Hoot see a roadblock. Turns onto another st to avoid it - two other Humvees following - and finds him in a killing zone. Complete chaos. In the turret, Pilla continues to fire. On the street, a Militia Man spin out from behind a corner and shoots Pill in the head. Suddenly the view swings straight up as he's hit in the h flops down into the Humvee, onto a stunned Ranger - Thoma Struecker turns in his seat, sees Pilla bleeding on Thoma who is hysterical.
Christ, he's fucked up!
He's dead.

head_text.subj: CUT BETWEEN CITY CENTER AND HUMVEE

text: (into radio) Struecker, talk to me!
(long pause, then) It's Sergeant Pilla.
What's his status? What's his status? Hoot turns around in the Humvee, instantly assesses:
He's dead.
He's dead. He's dead. McKnight and Steele both look stunned. Someone dead? That just doesn't happen here.
The casualties aren't gonna make it.
Garrison glances down briefly, then back up, JOC silent.  100 101 102 103 104 105 48.
A stunned hush -- static -- from the speaker. Then bullets hammer the outside of the truck --
Someone get on that .50! Hoot is already climbing up into the turret.

It's mine. OUTSIDE - Hoot sights a_line_of Somali gunmen_up ahead an on building tops. Hoot lets loose with a cruel sweep of t -50 caliber. Huge slugs blast into the masonry -- dust and stone mixin with crimson splatters of blood.
Wolcott flies above the city.

Mo'Alim drives a technical in reverse down a tight street keeping pace with Wolcott's circling Black Hawk. Mo'Alim SLAMS the brakes and three Somalia jump out with tubes. Mo'Alim leaps off the vehicle. His men with the RP await his signal. As the chopper turns in the sky --
Busch, Delta sniper, speaks into his headset --
I got three guys with RPGs coming up on your side now!
Mo'Alim shouts, his hand drops, and his men FIRE. WHOOOSH
Before Wolcott can react an RPG BOOMS into the tail rotor Busch's feet shoot out the cargo door.
All right, we got a hit! Stay with it!  106 107 108 109 49.
Garrison watches the drifting Black Hawk on a screen.
Going down, he's hit, he's hit!
Wolcott and copilot Briley are the picture of calm as gau go blank and the helicopter begins to spin.
Hey, Bull, you wanna pull those PCLs offline or what? Briley, already struggling to pull the levers, returns Wolcott's grin.
Roger, they're off, Elvis.
(remarkably calm) Six one going down...

head_text.subj: FROM EVERYONE'S POSITIONS ON THE GROUND

text: Eversmann, McKnight, Steele and others watch from their vantage points as Super Six One drifts away from their fi of view --
Bush grips a metal bar with one hand, chopper's spin INTENSIFYING.
Six One going down. Hold on!

IMPACT! The Black Hawk explodes into an enormous concrete fountain, flips sideways, slams onto the road, nose burro into the dirt, control panel crumpling, glass shattering inward -- Wolcott and Briley killed instantly. Everything enveloped in dust. Somalis run away in every direction.  50.
Garrison looks at the screen. Frantic voices on the comma net echo in the room:
We got a Black Hawk Down! We got a Black Hawk Down! We got a Black Hawk own!
Super Six one is down! We got a bird down in the city!
Durant scans the horizon.
We got a Black Hawk Down! We got a Black Hawk Down! FLASH - to Atto in his cell, sitting perfectly still, cig smoke swirling around his head. It's as if he knows what' happened...
ON SCREEN - the crash.
(into headset) Get an MH-6 on-site, check for survivors. Send in the SAR bird. I want ground forces to move and secure a new perimeter around that crash site. Can you guide the convoy in there?
Ah, Roger that.
Well, move quick. The whole damn city will be coming down on top of them. Harrell begins relaying the instructions down the chain t the pilots.
Two Five, this is Six Four, over?  115 116 117 118 119
Eversmann trying to find out what they're supposed to do now.
This is Two Five, over. EXT. CHALK ONE, HALWADIG ROAD - CONT.
Two Five, Chalk Four is closest to the crash site, over? EXT. CHALK 4 CORNER - CONT.
Six Four. I can't see the crash site. Over. EXT. CHALK ONE, HALWADIG ROAD - CONT. Steele is trying to communicate with Eversmann on the rad

Two Five, it's too East of you. You won't find it. At least secure the area. Repeat, move your chalk on foot to crash. Check for survivors, secure the area. All other chalks will follow, over? (nothing but static) Two Five, you read me, over?
Eversmann can't take it any longer. Signals to his men.

Goucher, Strick. Get Twombly! Hey, there's a Black Hawk down. Twombly Nelson, you're gonna stay here, you're gonna hold this corner, then exit with the Humvees. Galentine, Schmid, you're coming with me. All right? Let's go! Move out!
How come I gotta stay back here?
Because you're dependable. All right, let's go. Go! (CONTINUED)
Eversmann takes off with the rest of his Chalk: Galentine Yurek, Goodale, Kurth, Smith, Doc Schmid, and Waddell.
I hate being dependable, man. Steele looks down the block, sees a distant Eversmann and his Chalk leaving. He can't see Nelson and Twombly behind their cover. Steele thinks the message was received.
We just lost the initiative. Garrison stares at the downed Black Hawk on the screen.

Militia and irregulars emerge from alleys and buildings a the Bakara Market. As they begin moving east toward the c we RISE UP above the buildings, see some of them parallel the route Eversmann's small group is taking, just one blo over --

Let's go! As they become exposed around a corner, they take on heav fire. An RPG explodes at their feet. They return fire, th grenades. Little Birds provide cover from the sky, wipe out a Somal machine gunner, clearing the way for Eversmann's chalk.
Go! They run and fire.
Somali snipers are still firing from rooftops across the street. Wex ducks gunfire. SANDERSON BLASTS the rooftops.
We've still got guys inside.
All right, all right, I'm going to go to the crash. (CONTINUED)
Okay. You take the rest of the team; I'll finish loading the prisoners. Steele shouts to be heard.
Negative! We proceed to the crash site together | Secure the perimeter and wait for the Humvees! Roger, Sir!
Roger that.
I'll take the lead. Sanderson stares down the block, impatient.
Sir, are you receiving me?

I heard you. We should be leaving, sir. As if to punctuate his point, an RPG nicks the hood of a Humvee and explodes against the target building. Othic an Joyce duck, McKnight doesn't. Debris rains down on the Ra of Chalk One and Delta men.
All right, we need to move out now! I'll finish loading the prisoners, pick you up at the crash site.
(in unison) Roger!
Let's move out!
Come on, let's go! Chalk One and Delta element begin moving on foot toward t distant crash. McKnight loads up the prisoners.
Steele and his men are in the lead, Delta behind. In the rear, hugging the walls, is Grimes. Sanderson yells back (CONTINUED)

Hey, hey! Stay away from the walls, whoever you are! But the walls seem safe to Grimes. He's not getting away from them even if his life depended on it, which it does. chugs along behind the Delta to keep up as -- He hears a loud FWOOOSH!, turns to see -- AN RPG, streaking right at him. Grimes DUCKS behind a low wall as it ricochets and - BA-WHOOM! -- hits right above his head. Sanderson stops firing, looks back at Grimes who appears behind him.
You okay?
Yeah!
McKnight and Maddox jump in the Humvee and take off with Somali prisoners.
Let's go, Maddox! Maddox, look at these little skinny bastards! You muther fuckers! Go, go, go, left, left, left, left! Maddox steers with his shoulders hunched in fear.
Nelson and Twombly, left behind at Chalk 4, are crouched behind a burned-out technical, reloading. There are bodie of Somali gunmen around it. A Black Hawk flies overhead.
Twombly? Twombly!
What?
I think they've forgotten us!
What? (CONTINUED)
It doesn't matter.
Garrison watches the grainy images from P3 Orion as Somal militia run towards the downed Black Hawk.
Indigenous personnel move to the crash.
Say again, over?
A lot of people closing in.
How far is Chalk Four from the crash site?
About six blocks, Sir.
Well they need to haul ass!

Wolcott is dead. Dan Busch crawls out of the wreckage. He fires, trying to keep Somali gunmen from the downed chopp Targets pop up. Everywhere. Busch hits every one, pluggin rounds into the fleeting forms of armed Militia.
Garrison watches gunfire on the screen around the crash s EXT. CRASH SITE - CONT. Busch takes a bullet in the knee and nearly goes down.
The chalk splits, moves to opposite sides of the street. Gunfire erupts from the corner, Yurek, Kurth and Galentin running for a burned-out car. Galentine drops his weapon he dives for cover.
Scotty! Scotty, are you okay? (CONTINUED)

Across the street, Eversmann watches, then glances ahead sees the tip of a rifle poke out from behind the edge of building. Glancing back, he sees Galentine, obviously about to run back out to retrieve his weapon in the middle of the stre

No! Don't go! Galentine can't hear or can't understand and hurries out. cover him, Eversmann has to step into the street, firing the edge of the building. They continue moving. Then a Technical comes up behind th bullets flying. Galentine looks at his hand, covered with blood. His thum is hanging by a thread of skin.
Eversmann and the others are firing nearly nonstop. It's chaos.
Go, go, go! Eversmann crosses the street, ducks behind Yurek. Fires i that direction. Yurek signals the others to move.

Go! Go! The rest of the group continues along the block as Yurek cover fires at the approaching mob. He turns to follow th as KRATAKRATAKRAK! AK-47 gunfire wails down at Yurek, he kic in the tin door of the nearest structure he can find, div into --

-- a cramped schoolroom, cluttered with terrified kids huddling in a corner with their 16 year-old teacher. Bullets EXPLODE through the tin door. Bullets ZING! through the tin, explode around the room. Yurek puts his finger over his mouth to be quiet. (CONTINUED)
The teacher stares at him, nods. She gets the message. Yurek sees a back door. Moves over to it. Turns to the ki waves. One child waves back, smiles at him. Peeks out. Clear. Steps outside.

Pokes his head out to check the Street. Looks both ways a A SOMALI GUNMAN fires at him from one direction as -- The Somali's TEN YEAR OLD son, AK-47 too big for his little h FIRES from the other direction, poorly aimed bullets ricocheting off the crumbling alley wall, just missing Yu a bullet taking the heel of his boot off. Yurek pulls his head back just in time as -- The SOMALI M groans, hit by ricochet of his son's bullets. The man cru to the dirt, dying. Yurek sees the kid run past him to his father, on his kne over his father, wailing, AK-47 forgotten. Yurek holds hi gun on dying father and son. About to fire. Doesn't. Then runs.
The McKnight Humvee convoy starts up Halwadig. A voice crackles through the radio:
Unit One, this is Six Four, you have to slow down.
Romeo, Six Four, I need to know before I get to the god damned street!
You have to slow down, there's a delay from the time directions are relayed from P-3, to JOC, then to me.
McKnight yells back through the radio. (CONTINUED)
We can't slow down! We're taking heavy enemy fire! We can't slow down!
Sizemore is among thirty technicians, mechanics and cooks all gathered around a big radio, listening with dawning h at the drama out there.
(standing, to Cribbs) What in the hell is the status of Struecker's Humvees?
General Harrell, ETA to base, Strueker's column?
The convoy rumbles down the road. Thomas holds a bloody P Hoot stands at the turret gun, no longer firing -- in a d
Busch leans against the chopper wall surrounded by a doze dead Somali gunmen shot at close range. Busch's face is g Blood streams down his nose.
SILENCE. Garrison watches the Orion plane's grainy image Maier landing his Little Bird at the crash site.
A dust storm kicks up as Maier and his copilot Jones set Little Bird down in front of Wolcott's crashed Black Hawk

location: ADJACENT ALLEY TO BLACK HAWK CRASH

text: Eversmann and his guys come around the corner. Through a massive city archway, they can see Wolcott's downed chopp lying on its side. Little Bird whirling in front of it. Eversmann motions for his men to follow him. They charge through the enormous city gate, bullets slapping around t  142 143 59.

Clark and Jones run toward the crash from their Little Bi Finds Busch leaning against the Black Hawk, weapon aimed. Jones and Clark throw Busch's arm over their shoulders, a the three move to the chopper. Somali gunfire raining aro them.

location: ADJACENT ALLEY TO BLACK HAWK CRASH

text: Galentine, you alright? (Galentine nods) Covering fire! Go!

We'll cover! Eversmann and his team run in to the crash site. They are now in an enormous open area, four roads leading out -- f possible lanes of fire to worry about. Jones and Clarke get the limp Dan Busch into the Little B as Eversmann charges over, shouts:
Hey, how many are in there?
Two pilots are dead. Two crew chiefs are wounded. This guy's hurt bad. We gotta get out of here, now!

Okay. Jones helps Clarke inside, jumps in, Maier lifting off in the swirling dust as RPGs explode around the Little Bird. Eversmann crouches low, bullets pinging around him as he dashes to the downed chopper. Sees Wolcott's dead body. The Little Bird flies away. A Technical ROARS down the street. A Ranger shoots a rock at it. It bursts into flames as Eversmann sprints from Wolcott's Black Hawk, joins Smith and Goodale in a mortar cavity carved into a wall.
(into radio) Two Six, Two Six, this is Two Five. (CONTINUED)
The guys_are shooting up the technicals, over! EXT. CORNER NEAR WOLCOTT CRASH SITE - CONT. As Di Tomasso's Chalk 3 arrives at one of the cross stree he answers Eversmann.
Two Six, Two Six, roger that!
Di Tomasso! Take the Southeast border, we'll set up a perimeter, over?
Delta two Six, Roger that. Moving my men out. Move out! Di Tomasso nods and waves his men to a structure on the Southeast corner. They move and take immediate heavy fire
Captain Steele, Captain Steele, come in!
Eversmann Go ahead Two Five, this is Six Four!
We got two wounded and we got both the pilots dead in the chopper. We need a medivac over here now!
Two Five, they're telling me it's too hot to land the birds. You gotta secure the perimeter first, over.
Where are the Humvees?
Advise Two Five the convoy will be there. They're encountering light resistance. Six Four out. signals to Kurth.
Kurth! (CONTINUED)
Let's go! They move out.
STRUECKER'S THREE HUMVEES PULL IN to the Hangar area. Hun swarm toward them.

Hey, we need a medic! Hey, we need a medic immediately to get this last load in! Bloody bodies are carried out of the Humvees on stretcher Sizemore, cast on his arm, watches as Pilla is taken out, dead. Blackburn, broken. Half the others, bleeding. IN A HUMVEE -- Hoot's head peers in. There's already the buzzing of flies over the pools of blood and gristle.
Light resistance? It's the fucking end of the world -- sw of bullets raking the Humvee squad, RPGs streaking by wit deadly whispers, exploding into walls. A .50 gunner slump down in the turret, hit.
Get the .50 up! God dammit! A Ranger tries, can't get through the bodies blocking the way.
All I see is a roadblock.

Alright, I'm going to have to figure out another way. ON THE HUMVEE BEHIND - an RPG hits the back of the vehicl flinging Alberto Rodriguez, Wex and another man into the street like unwanted toys during a child's tantrum.
(leaping out, shouts) Give me a defensive perimeter so we can load the wounded! (CONTINUED)

Joyce, Kowalewski and other Rangers leap out, firing at . windows, doorways, rooftops. Othic near y steps on a hand the street, doesn't know whose it is. He'll figure it out later; puts it in his pocket.

Fire your weapon, Othic! McKnight comes upon the writhing Wex. The Delta Operator no lower half of his body. Wex is muttering something, somehow still alive, reaching at McKnight, taking his hand and squeezing.
Tell my girls they'll be okay. McKnight watches him die. Then yells out.
Othic! Othic runs low -- to McKnight's side.

Medic! Othic and a medic carry Wex, put him inside the Humvee.. Joyce returns fire. Then takes a shot in the back where h removed the vest panel. Crumples to the street. Kowalewski and McKnight drag Joyce's limp body toward the trucks.
Get us off this fucking street! (into radio) Where's the crash site? Say again?
Keep going straight 200 meters.
Okay. INT. MCKNIGHT'S HUMVEE - CONT. McKnight hops into the cab, bullets again exploding into convoy, SHOUTS to Maddox - (CONTINUED)
Let's go, let's go!

Silence. Nelson and Twombly, left behind at Chalk 4, are crouched in their bunker, reloading. There are bodies of Somali gunmen around it. But now, there is nothing but sporadic gunfire on the cor Nelson glances back down the block toward the target hous
Hey, Twombles?
What? Twombly stands and moves over to Nelson.
Come here! The Humvees ain't coming back, dude.
Really? Were we supposed to go to them?
I thought they were supposed to come to us.
Shit, I think we were supposed to go to them.
Shit!
Okay, let's go to the crash site.
Okay. Just don't fire that thing so close to my head. I can barely hea as it is.

Okay, move out. Nelson goes first. He makes it half a block before bullet start ticking the walls around him. Twombly covers. Nelso dives behind another smoldering automobile carcass, turns and covers as Twombly dives in beside him. (CONTINUED)
150 151 152 153 Suddenly an armed figure appears across the street; Twomb fires inches from Nelson's head. The gunman falls as the enormous boom of the SAW rings in Nelson's ears. He yells

head_text.subj: WHAT DID I JUST TELL YOU

text: Another figure appears, and Twombly has to fire again.
(in pain)
You okay? You alright?
(can't hear a thing - shouting) What?
Militia with RPGs strapped to their backs climb steps for better angle on the hovering Six Eight Black Hawk.
The Black Hawk takes fire.
Sunnavabitch. C2, this is Six Eight, we've been hit.
(into radio) Super Six Eight, there is smoke coming from the top of your rotor. Advise you to come out now.
Roger.
The Somalis set up to fire their RPGs at the Black Hawk.  154 155 156 157 158 65.
Art, I've got skinnies with RPG's at 12 o'clock, can you see them? Rangers slide down the ropes.
Go, go!
Got 'em. Give me 90 degrees left.
They're about to fire as the Black Hawk banks. Relentless machine gun fire from the Black Hawk mows them down insid the building.
Six Eight, coming out. He banks the chopper away.
Super Six Eight is out.
Eversmann runs for cover behind upended trucks.
Galentine! What's the situation in there?
Both pilots are dead.
(into radio) Two Five, we can't move these guys now. We'll kill 'em just carrying ‘em. (to other Medic) Stabilize in here?
Roger ! (CONTINUED)
Stabilize in here. Repeat, stabilize in the bird, over.
Understood Wilky, we got you covered, over.
(into radio) Super Six Four, come in and take Wolcott's position.
Roger. Six Four's inbound. He banks back toward the city center. Passes over rooftop

Militants with RPGs fire at Durant's chopper. An RPG missile streaks into Durant's chopper's tail. The Black Hawk rocks violently from the hit. The gauges blink but stay lit. Durant hears in his headset -
Super Six Four, you all right?
This is Super Six Four. We're good.
You sure? You look like you got clipped pretty good.
Durant and his copilot, Frank, check the gauges again. (CONTINUED)
Instrument panels are okay. No, we're good. Got a slight vibration in the pedals. But we're good.
All right. Put it down on the airfield, Super Six Four, have it checked out. Just to be safe.
Roger. Durant banks away from the crash site, heads south toward base, grid of narrow streets and alleys rushing beneath h OUTSIDE, the bent tail rotor is looser and rattling loude
Hey Ray, I'm getting a lot of movement in these pedals. Check the systems.

THE ROTOR PIN PULLS FREE, slices through the gear box, an the entire tail assembly evaporates in a blur. Inside, there's a high whine as the airframe vibrates. Du tries to correct the spin with the pedals; Frank kills th power with the ceiling levers.
We lost the tail rudder! Six Four's going down. Six Four going down!

SILENCE... Garrison watches the Orion plane's grainy imag of Durant's Black Hawk crashing. Eyes locked on the monit MONITOR - Durant's chopper hits the ground, crumpling, tw into the dirt like a whale on the beach, main rotor still chopping at the air like a gasp. After stunned silence in the JOC, Garrison finally speaks (CONTINUED)
Get Struecker's column back up there. They need to get to Durant's crash site, fast.
I'm on it.
All of them.
Super Six Four is down.
Militiamen and Rangers exchange gunfire. Eversmann glance over at Galentine, ghostly white, listening to his radio.
What? Then Eversmann's hip radio squawks, and he hears the voic on the command net:
Bird down! Super Six Four is down. Eversmann, looks at the faces of his chalk.
They talking about another hawk? His men nod.

Steele and his thirty some Rangers have entered a killing zone. Spread all over the road, his men are pinned down b gunfire from a fourth floor window in a building around t corner. They can't move forward down the street. DOWN THE STREET - Sanderson and his Delta (and Grimes) ar pinned down, waiting to move. Sanderson shouts through th walkie talkie:
Captain Steele, we gotta move or we're gonna get pinned down!
(CONTINUED)
We're moving as fast as we can! You let me do my job and you do yours! Over!
We're gonna get chewed up if we don't get off this street.
Ruiz fires when he's suddenly lifted and thrown against a wall, blood spraying out his back, bullet entering just u is vest.
Fuck! Fuck! Fuck, fuck, I fucking knew I was gonna get shot ! Steele and his Rangers are still pinned down. Steele hove over Ruiz.
Medic! A Ranger MEDIC crouches along the street, gunfire blastin over his head. Starts working on Ruiz. DOWN THE BLOCK - as bullets whiz past he and his Delta te SANDERSON mutters to himself --

Fuck this. (into radio) Cap'n Steele, we'll take out the window, we'li rally point at the gray building. Coming through, aptain! ON STEELE - he looks back at Sanderson and Delta down the block behind him.
Sergeant!

All right, let's move, let's move! SANDERSON clicks off the radio. Gives Delta command by ha signals. The Delta team moves down the block. Grimes looks behind him. No one there. He takes a deep br and hustles after Delta. ON STEELE - his position is under BLISTERING fire. (CONTINUED)
Sanderson and Delta - pass Steele and his beleaguered Ran without a second glance. Grimes keeps following Delta. KRATAKRATAKRAK! Bullets immediately track the Delta team from the fourth floor window.

Move! Move! Move! As DELTA move in a crouch alongside a five foot high eart mound. Bullets kick up plumes of dirt along the crest of the mou above Delta's heads as -- SANDERSON pulls a grenade, yanks the pin and runs up the earthen mound, hurls the grenade four stories into the op window -- a perfect toss. A MOMENT LATER -- the room explodes, shredded Somali bodi hurtling outward. More bullets rain at them from every direction:
Let's go! Let's move! Grimes runs along the earthen mound again. More bullets r past him as he runs. Steele and his Rangers follow the Deltas.
Move it!
Bullets rain down on Delta from every conceivable directi as they sprint to the first cover they can find. Sanderso is behind them and dives into --

A STABLE - no living animals here. Carcasses, bones, pile of moldering hay, ratty couch in a corner. High stone courtyard walls protect them from Somali bullets. Grimes, covered in concrete powder, runs inside.
Come on, come on! Let's go, let's go! Come on, bring 'em down!  71.

As Steele and other Rangers spill into the filthy stable courtyard an RPG blasts the building Rangers are help pin wounded comrades through the doorway, while groups of oth carry seriously wounded men.
Grab him! Move him! Move him out of here! Go, go, go! Steele whirls on SANDERSON, furious.
What the fuck are you doing out there?
Doing my job! Look, we gotta get to that crash site! We gotta get on that street and we gotta move! Now you have got to keep up, Sir! Steele says under his breath so the others won't hear:
(livid) We are combat ineffective. We've got too many dang wounded to move.

Then give me some of your shooters and it at'll get us closer to the ird! Steele nods. His eyes travel around the room. His Rangers are blood spattered, dazed, shell-shocked. Most are frank terrified. His gaze falls on Grimes.
Grimes! You're with Chalk Four! Grimes flinches.
Yes, Sir! Steele speaks to his Rangers, but he's looking right at Sanderson as he says:
All right, who's going with Delta? Grimes joins with Sergeant Eversmann. Grimes' face falls. (CONTINUED)

The rest of you men secure the position. Treat the wounded, and we'll wait for the convoy. Then we'll rally at the crash site. Roger! The other Rangers breathe a sigh of relief. Sanderson giv Grimes a once over. Shakes his head. This is who he gets? Finally he sighs, grabs his weapon.
My guys, let's go!

All right, let's cover him! A look from SANDERSON is all Delta needs to let them know they're moving out. They start filing back out into the dangerous streets. Grimes heads to the door, uncertain. With a last look bac at Steele, Grimes readies himself. Then he runs after Del
Sanderson and Delta emerge from the stable, Grimes traili Delta are fluid, moving from cover to cover, fanning out either side of the street. Grimes hustles after them.
Silence. Strapped to the seat of his downed Black Hawk, D slowly comes to.

Circling, Goffena and his copilot Yacone can see Durant's downed Black Hawk below. In back, also looking down at it, are Delta snipers Shugh and Gordon. There's a crowd moving toward the crash from several bloc away.
Romeo; Six Two. I got two Delta snipers volunteering to go in to secure Crash Site 2, over. (CONTINUED)
No, Six Two, that is negative to the request.
We don't see anything moving down there now. We don't even know if anyone's alive. A ground team is being organized to go in now.
ETA of ground team, over?
Ah, unknown. Not long. Do what you can from the air.
Still trapped to his seat, Durant sees through the shatte windshield the Black Hawk flying overhead.

head_text.subj: STRUECKER STANDS BEFORE THE BATTERED HUMVEES.

text: All right, gather around! All right, Durant's Six Four is down. (Rangers mutter in anger ) We're going back in to get ‘em. Now there is a prolonged silence. Rangers look at him lik he's nuts. Three Humvees behind him are bloody Swiss chee
That's crazy! Is there anyone alive on that? Thomas looks at other Rangers, some just as scared as he
It doesn't matter. No one gets left behind. You know that.
We're wasting time here.
All right! Refit, max out ammo and grenades. You've got five. (CONTINUED)
SIZEMORE is gearing up, wearing unlaced boots, swimming i an enormous extra flak vest.
Sizemore, where the hell do you think you're going?
With you guys.
Not with that cast on you're not. Sizemore pulls out his survival knife and goes to cut off his cast.
All right, all right, all right. Go get your K-pak. Struecker moves off to get ammo and sees Thomas' worried face.
Hey, talk to me.
I can't go back out there.
Thomas, everyone feels the same way you do, all right? It's what you do right now that makes a difference. It's your call. Hooah! Struecker walks off.
Hooah.

Hoot slaps in a magazine, already re -- supplied with gre and ammo. He grabs a bunch of night vision goggles, slips them in a pack. Rangers stare at him. Struecker is grabbing ammo when Hoot pulls him aside.
It'll probably help to wash the blood out of the Humvees.  183 184 75.

Struecker's Humvees are slowly pulling out, everyone, fro company cooks to mechanics running after it, geared up wi borrowed armor, leaping on, wanting to join in the fight. Thomas watches Struecker's loaded Humvee.
(running alongside) Sergeant Struecker, wait! Sergeant Struecker! Can I go, Sir?
You got some ammo? (the Ranger does) Hop in. Struecker looks back at Thomas. Thomas, taking a hit from his inhaler, finally summons th courage, runs to catch up.
Sergeant! Pulls the door open and jumps in.
Nelson and Twombly, still looking for crash site one, cha to a corner. The random burst of gunfire keeps them on ed
Which way? Twombly shrugs: which way? He motions down the street, le or right? Nelson looks down the street.
(shouting) That way I think.
(whispering) Sshh! Don't talk so fucking loud! Twombly hears something, coming down the block, a strange sound. -- clop, clack, clop. Motions Nelson back. Sound growing louder, closer. (CONTINUED)

Eyes wide, Twombly aims his SAW as --A DONKEY comes clopp past, pulling a cart without a driver. The animal briskly trots past Twombly, who nearly blew it head off. Twombly motions to Nelson. They RUN. DOWN THE BLOCK - on a different corner, YUREK is pressed against an alley wall, terrified, alone, eyes wide. Hears ghostly, disturbing sound, coming closer -- clop, clop, c Yurek prepares himself, gun aimed. The same donkey comes clattering into the alley, walks right up to the stunned Yurek.

Nice donkey. Yurek pats its head as he takes a look out into the wide intersection. Then he bolts -- RUNNING around a corner, d another block, around another corner. TWOMBLY AND NELSON level their weapons at him and start shooting.
Rangers!
Who?
It's Yurek, you fucking assholes!
Fuck! No, we almost fucking killed you! Oh, come to us! Yurek, completely out of breath; tries to speak.
Fuck You! Come to me! Twombly and Nelson run to Yurek.
Sorry Sarge.
Okay, never mind. You brought the NOD, right? Yurek gives him a weary Look. Gasps out -- (CONTINUED)
No. No, I didn't bring it. And you want to know why? ‘Cause you said: You're not gonna need that, dude, we'll be back in a half hour.
Man, I wasn't saying it to you.
(looks at Nelson) Nelson, cover this way. Nelson doesn't hear him.
Man, we're gonna need night vision. Yurek grabs Nelson. Nelson turns around.
What's the matter with you?
Huh?
Oh, he's deaf. It's my fault, I... We really need to get out of here.
We can't be far from the crash. Which way?
I thought you might know. They take off down the street.
Eversmann's men are shooting constantly, trying to keep t growing crowd of Somalis from the downed chopper.
(To Galentine) Give me Nelson and Twombly now! Galentine nods and clicks the handset of his radio, shout over the sounds of gunfire. (CONTINUED)
Nelson... Twombly, come in! This is Galentine. Over. Nelson, Twombly, come in, this is Galentine! We need the position of the convoy, over? Galentine shouts in frustration:
I can't raise them, Sergeant! I can't raise them! Eversmann swears under his breath as bullets EXPLODE over his head.
We gotta get the fuck out of here and evac!
No, we can't move “em. We're staying right here until the convoy gets here! Understood? (to all his men) We stay with the plan. Understood?
Let's get back to the stronghold! Come on!
Cribbs points to the map of Mogadishu. A big X represents Wolcott's crash, another, further away, Durant's crash.

Ground forces have occupied several buildings along Marehan Road -- they re all spread out. Eversmann's Chalk Four has set up a perimeter around Wolcott's crash site, here. (marks a spot) Id Tomasso is in the adjacent structure. (marks a more distant spot) Captain Steele and about forty men of Rangers are here, a couple blocks away. They're banged up pretty bad. He's set up a casualty collection oint. I, don't think they're gonna e able to move. Sergeant Sanderson and a small Delta team are moving from Steele's position to the crash site as we speak.  187 188 79.
Sanderson is behind wreckage made by a mortar blast. He s Grimes near him, wonders briefly where he came from.

When this guy stops firing, I'll have four seconds to get to their corner. Cover me. Go! Grimes nods as bullets SLAM into the wall above them. Gri runs forward. The gunfire pauses. Before Sanderson can move, Grimes has leapt out of the cr

I got it! GRIMES - charging the corner, seemingly taking forever to get there. He rounds the corner and comes face to face wi TwO SOMALI gunman, frantically trying to change magazines they see Grimes sliding to a stop before them. They slap the mags, raise their weapons, but -- Grimes waves a burs of gunfire over them.
(shouting)

An RPG slams into the wall behind Grimes, burying him in debris. This time he must be dead. Sanderson charges to the mound of rubble, tossing aside t pound chunks of mortar and concrete. Sanderson pulls Grim out, dazed, hair blackened, helmet gone.
(CONT'D) You all right? You okay, man?
Yeah! I can hear bells ringing. Sanderson gives Grimes a nod and a thumbs up.
(laughs) Come on, come on! Let's go! (CONTINUED)
Sanderson helps Grimes up.
A crowd scatters from the low-flying Black Hawk but then reforms again, heading toward Durant's crashed chopper. Goffena sweeps around to make another pass.
Romeo, Shughart and Gordon again request permission to secure until convoy arrives, over.
Garrison watches crowds of Somalis charge down the street the screen.
Matthews can barely hear Goffena over the frantic_voices the command net. He reaches out and SHUTS down all radio channels. Silence except for rotors. Speaks to Harrell:
General, crowd's in the hundreds now. From where they are, they can see it clearer than any of us. They know what they're asking.
Silence except for the static. finally --
Let me talk to them.
Shughart and Gordon hear over their headsets --
This is Garrison. I want to make sure that ya'll understand what you're asking for so say it out loud.
We're asking to go in to set upa perimeter until ground support arrives. INTERCUT to Garrison - (CONTINUED)
Now you understand I can not tell you when that might be. It could take quite a while.
Roger that.
And you still want to go in?
Yes, sir.
Garrison chews on this for a moment. Then:
Colonel Harrell.
Yes, General.
It's your call.
Roger that. Goffena? Put ‘em in.
Goffena turns and gives Shughart and Gordon the thumbs up
Visible through the windscreen, Durant looks up at the De snipers in the chopper above and sees Goffena's Black Haw fly off.
McKnight's convoy rolls through a hail of gun fire. INT. MCKNIGHT'S HUMVEE - CONT. McKnight shakes his head as casings rain down on him from the gun turret above.
Mother fucker, mother fucker! The Humvee takes fire from all sides. (CONTINUED)
A shaft of light tears through the door and into Othic's shoulder. A round hits Othic in the knee. He screams and then sees an RPG coming straight at the driver's door.

The RPG comes crashing through the metal -- but doesn't explode. The convoy stops. McKnight walks to Alphabet's truck and yanks the door ope Dazed, Othic looks to Kowalewski: there's a foot long RPG missile embedded in his chest, fins sticking out his left side, arm severed off. Kowalewski is dead.
There's a fucking bomb in him, Sir.
Othic, calm down, god dammit! That's live ammo! Now get out! Othic jumps out of the Humvee. McKnight gets Kowalewski o of the truck.
Come on, let's move him. Son of a bitch! The men lift the dead Kowalewski to a Humvee.
All right, lift him up, lift him up. Easy, easy, all right, get him in there. Good, good, easy, easy! Othic tries to climb into the Humvee as well as the men gingerly load Kowalewski in to the back.
Get back in that truck and drive.
I'm shot, Colonel.
Everybody's shot. We need the prisoners. Let's go!  83.
A voice crackles through the radio.
C3 says to take Halwadig and take it straight.
McKnight, we need you to turn around and head back to Halwadig. INTERCUT to McKnight - radios back --
You're shitting me. We just came through there. There's gotta be a better way!
That's the info I'm getting from JOC. You need to turn around and head back. McKnight looks at Maddox. Shakes his head.
Roger that, roger that. I cannot believe this shit. (sighs) Turn us around, Maddox.
They're trying to get us fucking killed, aren't they, Sir?
Just get it over with. Drive!
God damn!

Just, just get us outta here, god dammit! Drive! Resigned, Maddox executes a K-turn. The column slowly tur around. Maddox hits the gas. They head right back into the fray. Hell begins anew. HUNDREDS of rounds RAKE the vehicles, punching holes through metal. The windshield SHATTERS, spraying glass into Maddox's fac (CONTINUED)
AHHH! I'm blind. (grabs the wheel) Keep your foot on the gas! A bullet PINGS into the doorframe next to McKnight, slice into his neck. Blood sprays the dashboard.
